hellos peoples...not much to say at the moment, but currently not wanting to work or study so here I am looking at journals and thinking...ah...might as well write in mine.  So....what's up?  hmm...it's March...already...darn...this semester is going to go by so fast!  what am i going to do?  ::sniff:: i'll miss berkeley...and all the darn people I know that have decided to stay up here instead of going down south!!  haha...no worries tho...i might not even go down south either...well...within the next few years maybe not.  but it's scary, you know?  the future...even if you do know what you want to do...to be able to take that next step and put youself there.  it's intimidating...haha...i guess that's the thing about me...people are intimidating...they all seem to have done so much more and do so much better...everyone seems so much more capable.  but let the future come when it comes i guess...right now i want to enjoy life as it is.  my immediate future is being decided...haha...not much I can do about it now...and all i really want to do is plan my immediate future...what i'm gonna be doing 5 years from now....hey...it's the same thing everyone else will probably be doing...working...be it in a job they love and care about or a job they hate...or maybe in a job that they don't really care either way.  The next 3-5 years are mine...and i hope to make the best of it.  what i'll ultimately decide to do?  well...only time will tell.  I guess that's what everyone's doing right now...trying to find out who they will be...trying to prepare themselves into what they will be...never entirely sure what the ultimate outcome will be. 

anyways...on a brighter note i guess...i'm going to NY!!  haha...i finally found someone who wants to go there with me...(so sad...none of my friends like me...hehe..).  so it's tentatively planned for this summer...i'm excitied =)  she's a really good friend and it'll be fun to be able to spend more time with her...haha...i don't see her very often, but it's so great that we still talk you know?  She calls me up during breaks and we talk over e-mail and stuff...haha...it's so nice to know you're appreciated when a friend calls you up and ask you to do stuff ;)   hmm...i need more friends like that...hehe...

but yea...all i need now is to find someone to come with me to Europe and my life will be complete!  haha...yea, my friend is going with someone else to europe, so i'm stuck (hehe...doubt she'd want to go twice in a year).  hmm...it's more fun when it's with friends...haha...and i mean girls...i actually do want to spend time with my friends that are girls.  or...maybe a large group...that could be mixed...haha...=)  but yea...::sigh::  that doesn't really look like it's gonna happen anytime soon.  if anyone wants to tho...i'm game! =)  just ask!!  hehe...

oooh...and spring break is coming up.  what's planned?  nothing!  grr...no one wants to do anything either.  haha...people suddenly have something else to do.  eh...i do have an interview during break tho...so i guess i could prepare for that...i guess...haha.  sadly...if i want to do something...it's always up to me to try and plan it...for once, it'd be nice to just be invited to something that someone else plans.  eh...maybe i'll think of something to do...we shall see..

all right...that's it...enough procrastinating on here.  I should study...or at least look like i'm studying...hehe.  Two more midterms next week...and i would prefer not to fail them...so hence the mad studying.  all righty...to anyone who actually reads this...take care and good luck!

hehe...so long time no updates huh?  A whole semester has gone by without a trace of me :)  Yea...stupid classes are really busy and stuff's been going on lately.  Not many people know what's been going on with my life, but that's ok, I don't feel like explaining it to everyone...hopefully all goes well though...winter break is a much needed respite from it all.  

Anyways, what have i been up to?  not much, sad to say.  Last day of finals today and I took my last final.  Going to go home!!  yay!!  I want my month of vacation already :)  

Classes this semester have been all right.  Finance is stupid and econ is boring, but, hehe, not much I can do about it.  Was really tired of studying for finals.  worried about those two classes, but can't do much about that now.  Accounting has been fun, gotta love the tests...hehe...and marketing...met cool people to work on my projects with.  ::sigh:: kinda sad, i find that i miss writing...you know, essays and stuff.  Haven't done much of that this semester.  I had that competitive strategy report and all those marketing briefs, but that's not really much compared to "real" essays where you have to research and write.  hehe...does that make me a nerd? :)  Other than that tho, classes have been cool.  Business classes are not that bad...my favorites so far?  hmm...accounting and marketing were interesting...finance is stupid :)  so no job as an I-banker for me in the future...hehe, it's okay, couldn't handle the stress of that job anyways.  but yea, please dont' ask what i'm going to do with my life just yet...i really don't know...options are forming, but nothing really concrete just yet...i'm setting a path, but i'm not sure what will come of it...we shall see...

hmm...well this year, unfortunately, my birthday had to fall on the same day as 2 of my finals.  hehe...although for theo i think it was 3 finals.  so, couldn't do much to celebrate and everyone else was busy with finals too.  so, my b-day wasn't that grand...but special all the same, cuz, hehe, it's my birthday...and theo's as well! ^_^

okay, i think this is all i'm gonna write for today...mayhaps i'll come back to write later on this break or next semester.  I'll see you all later...have a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!

so i haven't updated in the longest longest time...but...ah well...ish all okay.  i don't hear anyone complaining just yet ;)  anyways, yay!! finally done with summer school and my internship.  it has been one heck of a summer these past 2 months.  craziness.  let's see if i pass tho...:/  hehe...anyways, yea summer school has been very tedious, yet can't help but say there were some good parts to it.  i found out that my professor lives in the apartment complex next door to me.  wow...he's kinda intimidating...he's the kind of professor that likes to make fun of people and is really cynical.  so yea...but he's a nice person once you get to know him i hear.  I also got to meet more people...and you know me with meeting more people...hehe...it's hard to do.  i can't say that i've made lasting friendships, but I have gotten to know more people in Haas, which is good.  wrote more papers than i would have liked during this summer.  also got some practice in with my resume and cover letter...haha...now all i need is experience.  also did a presentation...wasn't too bad once it was over...hehe...gotta get over this stage fright thing.  oddly enough tho, people were saying that I was really calm when I was speaking...very strange...i was sooooo scared and nervous.  hmm...anyways, work was fun.  honestly, kinda boring, but i did learn alot about computer applications and such. There will be many times in life when you lose yourself... your past. Your dreams. Your purpose. The reason why you live. 

And then there will be just as many times that will remind you of those things, and restore within you the faith to continue to tomorrow, as a better person than who you were before. 

Faith is like the wind. You don't see it, but you feel it. And there are times, many of which happen in my darkest moments, when I feel like the greatest dream and purpose in my life is to love, wholeheartedly and unconditionally. 

~~~~~back to me...

life is a series of choices...don't look back at all the bad choices you made but look forward to the good ones you have yet to make...

we all have regrets...but you have to make the best of it instead of dwelling on the regret...look to the future, not the past...

no matter what it is important to be there for those you care about...keep trying...keep talking...don't give up hope 

...more later...perhaps...

hello...so it's been ever so long since i last updated...mucho stuff to updates on.  not really sure where to start.  well...we shall start with my concerns beginning spring break.  so yea...i had my econ midterm to study for...didn't turn out that bad i guess...still haven't gotten the result back...but i can't say it went great.  ::sigh:: should i really be an econ major?  anyways, yea...i got accepted into HAAS :)  hehe...so after much deliberation, i decided to do a simultaneous major with Haas and Econ...and yes...i do know that it's practically the same thing...but hey, it's two degrees for doing the same thing...hehe...seems worth it...all i have to do is take one extra class for one semester than i would have.  I like both majors and want to explore both :)  housing...yes...the search was on once spring break ended.  I actually met this girl...Melinda...who had found an apartment and wanted a roomate...so I went over to see the place...it was nice...kinda...hehe...but yea...the place was taken once spring break was over so it was like we couldn't take it.  so i asked her if she was interested in looking with me for an apartment since we were both looking for one.  so yea...my new roomate now :)  I got to know cal rentals and craigslist very well...but i found some places that we could look at during the weekend.  we ended up only looking at two apartments on friday (three if you count the studio we looked at).  but the one we saw on oxford...really nice and we were thinking about getting it.  kinda far...but near edward ;)  hehe...so yea it was really really nice compared to the other apartments i've seen.  carpet...nice kitchen...dining room...one room...big livingroom.  seemed really nice.  so yea...the lady there liked us and we told her the next day that we were interested in it.  someone had already taken the other apartment in that complex so we like had to act fast...so before we knew it...we were signing the lease for the apartment.  crazy...so fast...but yea...i have an apartment!!! i'm not homeless!! hehe...:)  craze thing was that melinda turns out to be the girlfriend of the roomate of two of my old hall-mates last year who live in the suite in unit 1.  apparently july knows this guy too...as does charlotte.  strange coincidence huh?  hehe...yea...so...only dillema now is whether or not to take the room.  I think i will take the room...and she takes the living room...but...the living room has a lot more space than the room...but the room is more private...dunno...thinking...do you have any opinions?  

so yea...been studying for my cog sci midterm tomorrow...must study right now too.  it's been busy.  oh yea...i also got an internship for the summer!! hehe...so yea...i shall be in berkeley for the summer (summer school too).  much has been going on...that's the updates so far...probably have more that i don't remember right now...but must go study...to ttfn!!  more updates laters.

what is the world to do?  what is the nation to do?  what are the people to do?  if you know me, i don't really like talking about politics.  I realized a while ago that i'm a bit of an idealist when it comes to things like domestic and foreign policy and politics is nothing about idealism but about reality.  We are a democracy, made for the people, by the people and we must live up to these ideals.  life is a fragile thing.  there is nothing more scary to me than the thought of war.  not just cuz i don't believe it is the right thing to do, but also because of the many lives it will affect.  our lives will be irrevocably changed.  i still want to be sheltered.  because i'm scared of what will happen...of dealing with the aftermath...of dealing with the war.  I took american history, i took european history, i'm taking poliical science...i know what war does.  I can't say that there are many instances in history where war solved the great problems of the world.  and yet...is that what we're trying to do?  many people can cite many differnet reasons of why Bush wants war...and these all may be true...but maybe it's just me, but i don't want to risk everything that is good right now to what?  rid the world of iraq?  there will always be terroriests...there will always be hidden nuclear weapons...war is something that is done to (at the very least) solve some sort of problem.  what does this war solve?  i'm not into politics that much...and i've tried my best to stay away from any kind of news about the war...but it eventually reaches me anyways.  so i guess i must take this time to reflect...and not ignore it...(as a good friend has said to do).  it's a scary thing, this war...very ominous for everything.  my econ professor has talked to us about this...and has said some very thought provoking things.  we are all affected by the war in one way or another...whether we like it or not...we are connected.  kinda strange to hear that in a poll 80% of the population feels that we should go to war...hehe...makes me feel really out of the world view here in berkeley.  we feel that everyone around us believes that we shouldn't have war...but the rest of the nation...out beyond the boundaries of our little world in berkeley...a large mass of the population believes in the war.  what in it do they believe?  there must be something that would make them want it.  i'm not sure what we can do here...we can hope and pray...maybe things'll look up...just maybe.  the world might change, our lives might change...but i hope that we and our beliefs do not...i still believe in the idealism that this country was founded upon...and i still have hope for it to shine through.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

hmm...okie...time for other misc. updates...let's see.  Apprently i got into the econ major (yay!!)...hehe...but yea...got rejected from a few other things.  but don't think about that...all of it was a learning experience...yes...and i'll do better next time.  although i think for one of them...this was my last time...i'll find something else to devote my time to i think...dunno...life's strange sometimes.  the things we hope for...turn out differently from what we expect...eh...such is life.  anyways...tired now...i have 2 midterms this week.  so...wish me luck...and good luck to everyone else with midterms/finals this week.  Have fun during spring break...remember to visit me!!! ;)  hehe...k...g'nites
